Want a Mass. gun license? Where you live matters

A patchwork system in which geography, and gut instinct, can determine if someone gets a Class A license, the broadest gun license available under Mass. state law.

'Clark Rockefeller' murder trial to begin

Jury selection begins today in a Los Angeles courtroom in the murder trial of Christian Gerhartsreiter, who went by Clark Rockefeller when he was convicted in the 2008 abduction of his daughter in Boston. (8:36 a.m.)

Longtime BU hockey coach to retire

Jack Parker, Boston University's veteran bench boss, will leave a long legacy of success, including 894 wins (the most by a coach at one school), despite a report commissioned by the school finding a "culture of sexual entitlement" around the hockey team.

The Sinclair has growing pains

  The Sinclair is two venues: a music club and a restaurant. The restaurant hasn’t quite hit its stride. Beyond the missteps, which mostly center on the menu, you can see it is clearly on its way to becoming a vibrant addition to Harvard Square’s dining scene.
